landing.subtitle: User-Owned Agent OS for macOS
landing.description: Local-first. Transparent. 24/7 autonomous agents with a Task Manager you can trust.
landing.feature1Desc: Monitor CPU / RAM / network per agent in real time. Transparency like macOS Activity Monitor.
landing.feature2Desc: Prioritize OSS local models. Inference runs on your Mac, keeping data from leaving your device.
landing.feature3Desc: All external API calls to Claude, GPT, etc. require explicit user approval.
landing.feature4Desc: Set goals (OKRs) for each agent. Scheduled execution and heartbeat for autonomous operation.
landing.feature5Desc: Assign and auto-generate skills. Agents acquire capabilities and automate tasks.
landing.feature6Desc: No data collection by default. All access is policy-controlled and logged in audit trails.
landing.step1Desc: Install on Apple Silicon Mac via DMG. Takes just a few minutes.
landing.step2Desc: Enable Open at Login and agents will automatically start when your Mac boots.
landing.step3Desc: Check agent status in real time with Task Manager. Every action is transparent.

download.title: Download OpenNeo
download.subtitle: Compatible with Apple Silicon Macs running macOS 13.0+.
download.dmgStep1: Double-click the downloaded .dmg file to open it.
download.dmgStep2: Drag and drop OpenNeo.app to the Applications folder.
download.dmgStep3: Gatekeeper may show a warning on first launch.
download.dmgStep4: Go to System Settings > Privacy & Security and select "Open Anyway".
download.gatekeeperDesc1: macOS Gatekeeper may block apps from unidentified developers on first launch.
download.gatekeeperDesc2: Go to System Settings > Privacy & Security and select "Open Anyway", or right-click > "Open" to launch.
download.gatekeeperNotice: OpenNeo is notarized. It is not malicious software.
download.downloadConfirmDesc: You will be redirected to GitHub Releases to download the installer.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: OpenNeo is designed with privacy as the top priority. Your data belongs to you.
privacy.principle1Desc: All data is stored on your Mac. No data is sent to external servers by default. Agent execution, model inference, and file access are all processed locally.
privacy.principle2Desc: OpenNeo does not collect or sell your data by default. Usage analytics and telemetry are opt-in and no information is sent externally unless enabled.
privacy.principle3Desc: Diagnostic data submission for app improvement is completely opt-in. Only when explicitly enabled in settings will anonymized crash reports and basic usage statistics be sent.
privacy.principle4Desc: All connections to external APIs like Claude, GPT, etc. require explicit user approval. You can verify what data is sent to which service. Network control via policies is always enforced.
privacy.faq1A: Agent settings, OKRs, execution logs, and policy configurations are stored locally. All data is on your Mac's file system and encrypted. Nothing is sent to external servers.
privacy.faq2Q: Is my data safe when using external LLMs (Claude, GPT, etc.)?
privacy.faq2A: Requests to external LLMs are subject to network policies and access controls. User approval is required before sending, and you can verify what data is sent. Please also check the external service's privacy policy separately.
privacy.faq3Q: What happens to my data when I uninstall?
privacy.faq3A: Deleting the application also removes all related local data. Credentials stored in macOS Keychain can be individually removed via Keychain Access.app.
privacy.faq4A: OpenNeo core components are planned for open source release. It has undergone security audits to ensure transparency. You can review the source code directly.
privacy.faq5Q: Can it meet additional security requirements for enterprise use?
privacy.faq5A: Policy management, Credentials Vault, and audit log features can meet enterprise compliance requirements. Policies are exportable in JSON format and can integrate with external audit tools.
